column4: i installed ubuntu 9.10 now my wireless doesnt work.. how do i get driver for it?
how do i install driver for my wifi?
so what do i do now?
no its not a note book
it worked fine when i had ubuntu 9.04.. i found the driver in system-->administration-->hardware dirivers
maybe i can install it from synaptic.
were the ones you installed in 9.04 the Broadcom STA ones?
i am installing from synaptic... i think it works.
you should install bcmwl-kernel-source and b43-fwcutter
b43-fwcutter is the firmware installer for B43 cards.
In the future, you should probably use add-apt-repository command instead of adding the line manually.
so instead of downgrading xorg it would be better to use the older version itself?
if you care about difficulty and unsupportedness, yes.
ok. thanks. xorg from ubuntu 9.04 is not supported for my laptop.
